metadata.title: CVE-2022-48775 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Drivers: hv: vmbus: Fix memory leak in vmbus_add_channel_kobjkobject_init_and_add() takes reference even when it fails.According to the doc of kobject_init_and_add():   If this function returns an error, kobject_put() must be called to   properly clean up the memory associated with the object.Fix memory leak by calling kobject_put().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48775` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
